title: Enhance homepage layout and add backend-powered storefront configuration (including brand name option)

requirements.text: Update the homepage layout to be a more complete, scrollable landing page by adding at least these sections below the existing hero: (1) a "Featured Collections" section, (2) a "Why shop with us"/trust highlights section, and (3) a simple newsletter/signup call-to-action section. Ensure all sections are responsive and match the existing visual theme.

quotes: Okay, how will you do the homepage layout?

acceptanceCriteria: The homepage renders the existing header + hero + category showcase + footer, plus the three additional sections listed in this requirement, in a single scrollable page.
All new sections are responsive (mobile, tablet, desktop) and use the existing Tailwind/shadcn styling approach.
All user-facing text in the added sections is in English.

requirements.text: Make the header navigation links reliably navigate to the corresponding homepage sections by ensuring each target section has a stable anchor id and that clicking a nav item scrolls to that section (including for the categories already shown). Add a working mobile navigation experience (e.g., an expandable menu) so the same links are accessible on small screens.

quotes: Okay, how will you do the homepage layout?

acceptanceCriteria: Each top navigation item scrolls to a matching section with the same anchor id (e.g., men, women, children, infants, jewelry, shoes, pets).
On mobile viewports, users can open a menu and access the same navigation links.
No broken links: clicking any nav item moves the viewport to a visible section on the page.

requirements.text: Add backend "coding" by implementing a minimal Motoko API that provides storefront configuration data (brand/store name, hero headline/description, and the category list used on the homepage). Update the frontend to fetch this configuration with React Query and render the homepage content from the fetched data (falling back to current hardcoded defaults if the backend call fails).

quotes: And how will you add coding to the Coding Company Corporation?

acceptanceCriteria: The backend canister exposes at least one query method that returns a single configuration object containing: store name, hero headline/description, and category definitions (id/title/description).
The frontend uses React Query to fetch this configuration and uses it to populate the homepage hero and category grid content.
If the backend is unavailable or the call fails, the UI still renders using existing default content without crashing.

requirements.text: Support the brand name "Coding Company Corporation" by making the displayed brand/store name come from the backend configuration (REQ-6) and ensuring it is used consistently for accessible text (e.g., image alt text, sr-only labels, and any visible store name text). Do not remove existing KSM logo assets; only update text/labels to be data-driven.

quotes: And how will you add coding to the Coding Company Corporation?

acceptanceCriteria: Store/brand name displayed in the UI is sourced from backend configuration (with a sensible default such as the current "KSM Corporation").
Accessible text that references the store name (e.g., logo alt text) uses the configured store/brand name.
Existing logo image files remain unchanged and still load from /assets/generated/.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing shadcn components instead).

Do not modify files in frontend immutablePaths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo if an upgrade requires state migration.
nonGoals: Implementing a full product catalog, cart, checkout, payments, or order management.
Adding third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
Generating a new logo for "Coding Company Corporation" (text will be made configurable, but image/logo changes are out of scope unless explicitly requested).
